BiblioEntry.Title: Evaluation of different solutions to the left-right-neighbour and priority queue problems
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Evaluation of different solutions to the left-right-neighbour and priority queue problems / Johan Karlsson
BiblioEntry.SeriesInfoISBD: Master's thesis, ISSN 1402-1617 ; št. 173

Notes.Dissertation: Luleå University of Technology, Department of Computer Science and Electrical Engineering, Division of Computer Science

BiblioEntry.Abstract: In this thesis we study two problems defined on elements drawn from a bounded universe of size ▫$M$▫. The problems are: the problem of maintaining a dynamic sets of elements, in order to answer queries about the left and right neighbour of an arbitrary element from the universe and the related Priority que Problem. Several different solutions, such as Split-Tagged-Tree, vEB Stratified Tree and heap, are compared, implemented and tested. We also introduce a simplification of the Split-Tagged-Tree and use it to solve the Priority Que problem. In some of our solutions we use a model of computation called RAMBO with extends the RAM model with a special memory block. Under this model the simplified Split-Tagged-Tree uses ▫$3M+O(\lg M)$▫ bits and permits constant time operationson the Priority Queue. In comparison, under the same model the general Split-Tagged-Tree uses ▫$5M+O(\lg M)$▫ bits and permits queries of the Left-Right-Neighbour problem to be ansvered in constant time. The test results show that we can solve the Priority Queue problem efficiently using the simplified Split-Tagged-Tree and a special hardware implementing the RAMBO.

BiblioEntry.Subtitle: magistrsko delo
master of science thesis

Notes.Dissertation: Univerza v Ljubljani, Biotehniška fakulteta, Oddelek za zootehniko. Mentor: Milena Kovač, Andrej Brodnik

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Stopnja razvitosti informacijske tehnologije danes omogoča in celo narekuje uporabo računalnika kot pripomočka na živinorejskem obratu. V slovenskem prostoru so potrebe po programski opremi v živinoreji vedno večje, pojavljajo se posamezni komercialni programski paketi. Naša naloga je z uporabo postopkov informacijske analize zasnovati računalniško podprt nformacijski sistem (IS) za potrebe prašičereje. Izgradnja celovitega IS presega obseg magistrskega dela, zato smo se osredotočili na tisti del prireje, ki ga rejec pri delu v hlevu najbolj potrebuje. Pri informacijski analizi uporabljamo dve metodi, procesno usmerjeno metodologijo in metodo, ki temelji na tokovih podatkov. Zaradi povezljivosti rejca z repuliško selekcijsko službo za prašičeuporabljamo strojno in programsko opremo razvojnega okolja Linux, različici operacijskega sistema Unix. V okviru mednarodnega projekta za razvojod okolja neodvisnega sistema APIIS predlagamo rešitev enolične identifikacije živali v sistemu, ki je uporabna v primeru trajnega ali začasnega označevanja. Skupine udeleženke projekta med seboj usklajujemo entitetno-podatkovni model, pri čemer posamezne tabele postanejo obvezni sestavni element podatkovne baze. Razvite so ekranske slike za vnos podatkov na področjih rodovništva in registracije ter reprodukcije.

A development level of information technologies is enabling and dictating the usage of personal computer as a tool on a farm plant. In Slovenia there is an upward trend of software needs, first commercial software is already on the market. Our task is to design a computer based information system for pig production needs that will be based on information analysis procedure usage. Development of the complete information system is exceeding the range of this master of csience thesis therefore it is based on production field, the farmer's most demanding part. Two main methods are used at the information analysis: process focused and data flow based methodology. In the project Linux (Unix variety) based environment is used because of the link-up among the national selection service for pigs and breeders. In the frame of the International Project for development of an Adaptable Platform Independent Information System - APIIS we recommend the unique animal identification use in the system on permanent or temporary marking. Project member groups were harmonizing entity-data model wherein the single tables become obligatory element of the database. Graphical user interfaces for data entries in the field of identification and registration and also for reproduction were developed.

BiblioEntry.Title: Minimum curvature variation B-splines validation of a path-planning model
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Minimum curvature variation B-splines validation of a path-planning model / Thomas Berglubd ... [et al.]

BiblioSet.Title: Preprint series
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Preprint series
BiblioSet.Keytitle: Prepr. ser. - Univ. Ljubl. Inst. Math.

BiblioEntry.Abstract: We study the problem of computing smooth planar paths in the presence of obtacles. We investigate the relationship between smoothness of a path and its traversal time in the case of a four-wheel four-gear articulated vehicle. Smoothness is measured by minimum curvature variation, i.e., by the integral over the square of the derivative of curvature along the path. Paths are defined by B-splines or piecewise polynomials and obstacles are represented by polynomial chais. Obstacle-avoidance is achieved by means of the envelope of B-splines. We present eight real-word cases based on application data from the Swedish mining company LKAB. The cases show that our minimum curvature variation B-spline path-planning algorithm yield paths that are substantially better that the one used by LKAB today.
BiblioEntry.Descriptors: numerical analysis /industrial applications /smooth planar paths /minimum curvature variation /B-splines

BiblioEntry.Title: Data structure for a time-based bandwidth reservation problem
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Data structure for a time-based bandwidth reservation problem / Andrej Brodnik, Andreas Nilsson

BiblioSet.Title: Preprint series
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Preprint series
BiblioSet.Keytitle: Prepr. ser. - Univ. Ljubl. Inst. Math.

BiblioEntry.Abstract: We discuss a problem of handling resource reservations. The resource can be reserved for some time, it can be freed or it can be queried what is the largest ammount of reserved resource during a time interval. We show that the problem has a lower bound of ▫$\Omega(\log n)$▫ per operation on average and we give a matching upper bound algorithm. Our solution also solves a dynamic version of the related problems of a prefix sum and partial sum.

BiblioEntry.Title: Extended expedited forwarding : the In-Time PHB group
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Extended expedited forwarding : the In-Time PHB group / Johan Karlsson ... [et al.]
BiblioEntry.Subtitle: the In-Time PHB group

BiblioSet.Title: Preprint series
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Preprint series
BiblioSet.Keytitle: Prepr. ser. - Univ. Ljubl. Inst. Math.

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Dandanes postajajo na internetu aplikacije v realnem času vedno pogostejše. Kakovost teh aplikacij se posebej izboljša z zagotavjanjem omejitve zamud v dostavi podatkov in z zagotavljanjem odstotka prenešenih podatkov. V tem članku je predstavljen nov način obravnavanja prometa na posamezni povezavi. To obravnavo imenujemo pravočasna predaja (In-Time). Obravnava zagotavlja prioritetnemu prometu popoln pretok, preostalemu pa enakovredno obravnavo. Predstavljana rešitev, ki zahteva ▫$O(1)$▫ časa na paket, je bila tudi preverjena na omrežnem simulatorju.

The paper presents a new set of forwarding behaviors that fits rate-adaptive and delay-sensitive applications with limited loss tolerance. We consider an application to have limited loss tolerance if it needs loss-free forwarding of specific packets up to certain rate. The new set of forwarding behaviors are attractive for developing real-time applications for the Internet. In particular, such applications can be designed to use reserved forwarding capacity efficently and compete for more bandwidth while being fair to best-effort traffic. To provide the new set of forwarding behaviors, we define a scheduling mechanism that can be implemented efficiently. Through simulations, we show that this mechanism supports the defined forwarding behaviors.

BiblioEntry.Title: A static data structure for discrete advance bandwidth reservations on the internet
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: A static data structure for discrete advance bandwidth reservations on the internet / Andrej Brodnik, Andreas Nilsson

BiblioSet.Title: Preprint series
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Preprint series
BiblioSet.Keytitle: Prepr. ser. - Univ. Ljubl. Inst. Math.

BiblioEntry.Abstract: We present a discrete data structure for reservations of limited resources. A reservation is defined as a tuple consisting of the time interval of when the resource should be reserved, ▫$I_R$▫, and the amount of the resource that is reserved, ▫$B_R$▫, formally ▫$R=\{I_R, B_R\}$▫. The data structure is similar to a segment tree. The maximum spanning interval of data structure is fixed and defined in advance. The granularity and thereby the size of intervals of the leaves is also defined in advance. The data structure is built only once. Neither nodes nor leaves are ever inserted, deleted or moved. Hence, the running time of the operations does not depend on the number of reservations previously made. The running time does not depend on the size of the interval of the reservation either. Let ▫$n$▫ be the number of leaves in the data structure. In the worst case, the number of touched (i.e. traversed) nodes is in any operation ▫$O(\log n)$▫, hence the running time of any operation is also ▫$O(\log n)$▫.

BiblioEntry.Title: Multiprocess time queue
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Multiprocess time queue / Andrej Brodnik, Johann Karlsson

BiblioSet.Title: Preprint series
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Preprint series
BiblioSet.Keytitle: Prepr. ser. - Univ. Ljubl. Inst. Math.

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Opisana je izvedba omejene časovne vrste, ki jo upravljata dva procesa. Časovna vrsta je različica prednostne vrste elementov iz končne univerzalne množice. Eden od procesov ima časovno omejitev, da mora nekatere operacije izvesti v konstantnem času, medtem ko drugi proces izvaja vse operacije brez časovnih omejitev. Pokazan je postopek deamortizacije operacije "deleteMin" in kako zagotoviti vzajemno izključevanje med procesi pri delu na skupnih delih podatkovne strukture.

We show how to implement a bounded time queue for two different processes. The time queue is a variant of a priority queue with elements from a discrete universe. The bounded time queue has elaments from a discrete bounded universe. One process has time constraints and may only spend constant worst case time on each operation while the other process may spend more time. The time constrained process only has to be able to perform some of the time queue operations while the other process has to be able to perform all operations. We show how to do a deamortization of the deleteMin cost and to provide mutual exclusion for the parts of the data structure that both processes maintain.

BiblioEntry.Title: Worst case constant time priority queue
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Worst case constant time priority queue / Andrej Brodnik ... [et al.]

BiblioSet.Title: Preprint series
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Preprint series
BiblioSet.Keytitle: Prepr. ser. - Univ. Ljubl. Inst. Math.

BiblioEntry.Abstract: V prispevku je predstavljena nova podatkovna struktura velikosti ▫$3M + o(M)$▫ bitov. Struktura je uporabljena za reševanje problema "diskretne prioritetne vrste". Če uporabimo opisano strukturo z novo pomnilniško topologijo, dobimo rešitev v največ konstantnem času.

We present a new data structure of size ▫$3M+o(M)$▫ bits for solving the "discrete priority queue" problem. When this data structure is used in combination with a new memory topology it provides an ▫$O(1)$▫ worst case time solution.

BiblioEntry.Title: Sub-linear decoding of Huffman codes almost in place
BiblioEntry.TitleISBD: Sub-linear decoding of Huffman codes almost in place / Andrej Brodnik, Svante Carlsson

BiblioSet.Title: Preprint series
BiblioSet.TitleISBD: Preprint series
BiblioSet.Keytitle: Prepr. ser. - Univ. Ljubl. Inst. Math.

BiblioEntry.Abstract: Predstavljamo jedrnato podatkovno strukturo, ki omogoča pod-linearno dekodiranje Huffmanovih kod v sorazmerju s prenešenimi biti. Velikost podatkovne strukture, poleg same abecede, je le ▫$O(l\log N)$▫ bitov, kjer je ▫$l$▫ najdaljša Huffmanova koda in ▫$N$▫ število znakov v abecedi. Naša rešitev je uporabna tako za majhne abecede z nekaj sto znaki, do več kot 68000 znakovne abecede in v vseh primerih zahteva le med tretjino in petino dostopa do pomnilnika v primerjavi z običajnimi postopki. Velikost dodatne strukture v nobenem od naših primerov ni presegla 342 zlogov. Takšna struktura bo z veliko verjetnostjo lahko shranjena v cache procesorju, kar pomeni, da bo dekodiranje še hitrjše.

We present a sufficient data structure storing the Huffman encoding that permits sublinear decoding in the number of transmitted bits. The size of the extra storage except for the storage of the symbols in the alphabet for the new data structure is ▫$O(l\log N)$▫ bits, where ▫$l$▫ is the longest Huffman code and ▫$N$▫ is the number of symbols in the alphabet. We present a solution that typically decodes texts of sizes ranging from a few hundreds up to 68000 with only one third to one fifth of the number of memory accesses of regular Huffman implementations. In our solution, the overhead structure where we do all but one memory access to, is never more than 342 bytes. This will with a very high probability reside reside in cache, which means that the actual decoding time compares even better.
